block.p: Amy Elizabeth Carolan, a daughter of Richard Carolan of Barrington, R.I., and the late Mary-Louise Gilbane Carolan, was married yesterday to John D'Arcy Tyree, the son of the late Joan Brophy Tyree and Col. Thomas B. Tyree. The Rev. Daryl W. Stahl, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the New York Yacht Club in Newport, R.I.

Mrs. Tyree, 28, graduated from Brown and is a candidate for a master's degree in education at New York University. Her father is the founder of Carolan & Company, a municipal bond firm in Providence, R.I.

Amy Elizabeth Carolan, a daughter of Richard Carolan of Barrington, R.I., and the late Mary-Louise Gilbane Carolan, was married yesterday to John D'Arcy Tyree, the son of the late Joan Brophy Tyree and Col. Thomas B. Tyree. The Rev. Daryl W. Stahl, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the New York Yacht Club in Newport, R.I.

Mrs. Tyree, 28, graduated from Brown and is a candidate for a master's degree in education at New York University. Her father is the founder of Carolan & Company, a municipal bond firm in Providence, R.I.

Mr. Tyree, 34, an investment banker, is a vice president at Morgan Stanley Dean Witter in New York. He graduated from the United States Military Academy at West Point and received an M.B.A. degree from Dartmouth College. His father, who retired from the Army, was an assistant commissioner of the New York State Department of Transportation and a trustee of the Military Academy. The bridegroom's maternal grandfather, the late Thomas D'Arcy Brophy, was the chairman and chief executive of Kenyon & Eckhardt, the New York advertising agency.
